Read more Follow @mlwestphal Skip to content Loves Park Vietnamese restaurant closes, bistro taking its place Posted on February 16, 2011 at 11:58 am by Melissa Westphal Tweet A Vietnamese restaurant in Loves Park closed recently but another restaurant will soon take its place.
Saigon Vietnamese Noodle Soup Restaurant, 6164 E. Riverside Blvd., closed after just about a year in business. It opened Sept. 9, 2009, near Riverside and Mulford Road, and its menu featured noodle soups and dishes like pad Thai.
Signs are up at the space that say a new bistro will open there this spring. The restaurant is called Bistro108, and it’s an American-style bistro that will feature casual dining and fresh food.
Tom Seeling and Jennie Braun are the owners. I’ll be chatting more with them and will update the blog soon.

Quentink says: February 16, 2011 at 12:43 pm I liked Saigon and was hoping they would make it. Well Pho Square is still serving up some fantastic pho right down the street so I can still get my fix when I’m on Riverside. Commenter says: February 16, 2011 at 1:43 pm Pho Square is awesome, and I hope they are doing well, and if so, continue doing well in this area, it\’s some good stuff. NEJ6719 says: February 16, 2011 at 4:05 pm I can’t wait to see what this new Bistro has to offer! That area needs some more good dining. Milton Waddams says: February 16, 2011 at 4:45 pm I went to Saigon a couple of times, it was good. Shame they didn’t make it. I’ll have to try pho square. greggy says: February 16, 2011 at 7:29 pm Looking forward to a new restaurant that is not a chain or an Italian restaurant as this seems to be what we have most in the area. Michelle says: February 17, 2011 at 7:55 am Thai Cuisine, in the mall with Choices Natural Market, has some good vietnamese entrees. They have pho and vietnamese spring rolls. Spring rolls are good–a bit big to handle without making a mess. Their Tom Yum soup is awesome! NEJ6719 says: February 17, 2011 at 11:24 am I’m looking forward to some choices at the new restaurant. It’s great to see more locally owned and operated businesses coming to the area rather than more chains. Melissa Westphal says: February 17, 2011 at 1:08 pm Milton: Definitely give Pho Square a try. I agree with Quentink and Commenter—the food there is great, especially the pho and the spring rolls. I’ll have to try the pho and spring rolls at Thai Cuisine. Thanks for the tip, Michelle!
